comment: Device Settings Accessibility Resource Type adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.OCF/master/settings-accessibility/schema.json
description: Smart Data Models Program adaptation of the original IoTData data Models. Gets current device accessibility settings.

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: caption
contents.comment: Turns on or off accessibility caption.

contents.name: caption-mode
contents.comment: Accessibility Caption Mode. Client can change caption-mode using supported-caption-modes property.

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform

contents.name: enlarge
contents.comment: Turns on or off print enlargement.

contents.name: high-contrast
contents.comment: Turns on or off high contrast.

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object

contents.name: video-description
contents.comment: Turns on or off video description.

contents.name: voice-guide
contents.comment: Turns on or off voice guide.

contents.name: if
contents.comment: No description is available in the original

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: rt
contents.comment: The Resource Type of Device Settings for accessibility

contents.name: supported-caption-modes
contents.comment: The array of possible caption modes the device supports. This property should be added if caption-mode is supported.
